gears.sidescroller.world.machines

Class AbstractMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • gears.sidescroller.world.core.ObjectInWorld
      • gears.sidescroller.world.machines.AbstractMachine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Collidable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConveyorBeltSegment, GearMachine, PowerPlant

    public abstract class AbstractMachine
extends ObjectInWorld
    Machines are interactable elements in the game world. Machines must be powered to update, though this power may be applied either externally via the PowerGrid, or internally, by setting the Machine's isSelfPowering property to true.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gears.sidescroller.world.core.ObjectInWorld

      • AbstractMachine

        public AbstractMachine(int x,
                       int y,
                       int w,
                       int h,
                       boolean selfPowering)
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of this machine, measured in pixel-space
        y - the y-coordinate of this machine, measured in pixel-space
        w - the width of this machine, measured in pixel-space
        h - the height of this machine, measured in pixel-space
        selfPowering - whether or not this machine should provide power to itself

    • Method Detail

      • setExternallyPowered

        public final void setExternallyPowered(boolean b)
        This method will be invoked by the PowerGrid when this machine is being externally powered.
        Parameters:
        b - whether or not this machine is powered by the PowerGrid

      • isPowered

        public final boolean isPowered()
        Returns:
        whether or not this machine is being powered, and therefore should update

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Updates the machine. Note that this method is only invoked when the isPowered method returns true, so you needn't check for yourself. Machines can use this method to update animation frames, if you want.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Renders this machine on the given Graphics context.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object to render this on

      • checkForCollisions

        public abstract boolean checkForCollisions(MobileWorldObject e)
        Checks for collisions with the given AbstractEntity, and reacts accordingly. Remember that you can always use this.getCollisionBox().isCollidingWith(e) to make life easier for yourself.
        Parameters:
        e - the AbstractEntity to check for collisions with
        Returns:
        the boolean
